benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/customFields - Retrieve bundle custom fields

covered: Valid Request: Success paths well covered (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC11, TC12, TC15) — default audit behavior and explicit audit=FULL/MINIMAL, schema checks and 200 responses are asserted.
Empty Response: Behavior when a bundle has no custom fields is tested (TC04) and returns an empty JSON array with 200.

Query Parameters: Audit parameter handling is exercised for valid (FULL, MINIMAL, default NONE), invalid, partial/malformed and XSS values (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC07, TC13, TC18). Extra/unexpected query params are tested (TC10).

Error Handling / Status Codes: 400 for invalid bundleId format (TC06) and 404 for bundle-not-found (TC05) are covered. Dependency failures are handled via 503 tests for DB and audit service unavailability (TC09, TC16).
Authorization (partial): Missing/invalid token case covered (TC08) returning 401.
Content-Type and Schema: Response Content-Type application/json and JSON validity are covered (TC20); schema validation for CustomField objects is asserted (TC01).
Security: Injection/XSS tests are included (TC17 for SQL injection, TC18 for XSS) to validate input sanitization/validation.
Performance & Concurrency: Large dataset / performance threshold checks and concurrent request behavior covered (TC14, TC19).
Regression & Integration: Regression test for previously known bug and integration failure modes covered (TC15, TC16).
gaps: Pagination: No tests for pagination/limit/offset/continuation handling. If the API supports paging for large result sets this is not covered; if it is intentionally non-paginated this should be documented and tested.
Caching Behavior: No tests validate caching headers or conditional GET semantics (ETag, Cache-Control, If-None-Match -> 304).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests exercise rate limits or 429 responses / Retry-After behavior under high request rates; concurrency is tested but rate-limit responses are not.
Authorization (missing coverage): Role/permission-based denial (403) is not tested — e.g., valid credentials but insufficient permissions.
Error Body Consistency & Schema: Tests do not assert the structure/content of error responses (standard error fields, error codes, messages) beyond presence of an error message.

Boundary & field-level validation: While invalid bundleId and malformed audit are covered, there are no explicit negative tests for field-level schema violations in returned CustomField objects (missing required fields, wrong types), nor exhaustive format checks for audit timestamps/UUID fields.
recommendations: Add pagination tests (page/limit/offset or continuation token) if the endpoint supports paging; if it does not, add an explicit test asserting the API is non-paginated and can return large result sets reliably.
Add caching tests: verify ETag/Cache-Control headers, and conditional GET (If-None-Match) results in 304 when unchanged; verify Vary headers where applicable.
Add rate limiting tests to simulate burst traffic and verify 429 responses and Retry-After header behavior; include negative tests to ensure graceful degradation.
Expand authorization tests to include 403 scenarios (valid token but insufficient permissions/roles) and expired/invalid token variants (401 with more detail).
Assert error-response schema consistently (fields like code, message, details) for all error cases (400, 404, 401, 403, 503, 429) to ensure clients can programmatically handle errors.
Enhance schema validation for CustomField objects: verify required properties, types (UUIDs, timestamps), lengths, and audit field presence/format across NONE/MINIMAL/FULL responses.
Add additional security fuzzing: long/oversized bundleId/audit values, header injection, URL-encoded payloads, and negative tests for other input vectors beyond SQL/XSS already present.
Include content-negotiation tests (Accept header variations) and explicit tests that Content-Type is exactly application/json and that unsupported Accept values are handled appropriately.
Define and add measurable performance thresholds for TC14 and include monitoring of resource usage during large responses to catch degradation/regressions.
